vehicles.description: A three-wheeled vehicle parked on the right side of the road, partially obstructing the rightmost lane, with its rear cargo area open and objects laid out beside it.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle may cause unexpected pedestrian movement around it and could start moving into traffic, necessitating caution from the ego vehicle. It is improperly parked and may force the ego vehicle and others to maneuver around it, reducing the usable width of the road and potentially affecting the flow of traffic.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Multiple pedestrians, including one pushing a stroller, adults, children, a person holding a child's hand, and another person wearing bright yellow, are standing on the curb by a crosswalk ahead on the right, seemingly waiting to cross the street.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Pedestrians close to the roadway and at a crosswalk can enter the road at any moment, therefore the ego vehicle should be prepared to stop or slow down. Their intent to cross requires the ego car to prepare to stop to give them the right of way as they are directly in the path of the vehicle's intended travel.

traffic lights.description: No traffic lights are visible in this image.
traffic lights.explanation: With no visible traffic lights, the ego car should follow right-of-way rules applicable to intersections and pedestrian crossings. Without visible traffic signals, the ego car should proceed with caution, especially due to the presence of pedestrians at the crosswalk.

barriers.description: Yellow and black curbside barriers are visible to the right of the ego vehicle, marking the boundary of the pedestrian area.
barriers.explanation: These barriers help in delineating the driving space from the pedestrian zone and guide the vehicle on where not to drive.

other objects.description: There is an open dustbin to the immediate right of the ego vehicle, adjacent to the parked three-wheeled vehicle.
other objects.explanation: This object, although not directly obstructing the lane, contributes to narrowing the usable road space and necessitates cautious driving.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, there is a three-wheeled vehicle parked on the right side of the road, partially obstructing the rightmost lane with its rear cargo area open and objects laid out beside it. This vehicle may cause unexpected pedestrian movement around it and could start moving into traffic, which requires the ego vehicle to exercise caution. It is improperly parked, forcing the ego vehicle and others to maneuver around it, reducing the usable width of the road and potentially affecting traffic flow.

Additionally, there are multiple pedestrians, including one pushing a stroller, adults, children, a person holding a child's hand, and another person wearing bright yellow, standing on the curb by a crosswalk ahead on the right, appearing ready to cross the street. Pedestrians close to the roadway and at a crosswalk can enter the road at any moment, so the ego vehicle should be prepared to stop or slow down. Their intent to cross necessitates that the ego car be ready to stop to give them the right of way as they are directly in the path of the vehicle's intended travel.

No traffic lights are visible in the image, which means the ego car should follow right-of-way rules applicable to intersections and pedestrian crossings. The absence of traffic signals indicates that the ego car should proceed with caution, especially due to the presence of pedestrians at the crosswalk.

Yellow and black curbside barriers are present to the right of the ego vehicle, marking the boundary of the pedestrian area. These barriers delineate the driving space from the pedestrian zone and guide the vehicle on where not to drive.

Lastly, there is an open dustbin to the immediate right of the ego vehicle, adjacent to the parked three-wheeled vehicle. Although not directly obstructing the lane, the dustbin contributes to narrowing the usable road space and necessitates cautious driving.

1.description and explanation: This object appears to be a pedestrian carrying items and is located close to the vehicle path on the side of the road. The presence of this pedestrian suggests that the driver of the ego vehicle should be cautious and prepared to stop or yield, as the pedestrian might enter the roadway which would require the driver to adjust speed or path to ensure safety.

driving_suggestion: The ego car should reduce speed and be prepared to stop for pedestrians who might step onto the crosswalk. Be vigilant for any movement from the parked three-wheeled vehicle on the right, and be ready to yield to it if it enters the roadway. Maintain a safe distance from parked vehicles to allow room for maneuvering if anyone steps out from behind the vehicle or if it starts moving unexpectedly. Additionally, the vehicle should prepare to safely navigate around the improperly parked three-wheeled vehicle on the right, paying attention to the open dustbin and ensuring not to enter the pedestrian zone marked by the barriers. The driver must be prepared for sudden movements from the pedestrians and any other unexpected obstacles. The ego vehicle should also be prepared to change lanes to the left if the lane ahead remains obstructed by the stationary three-wheeled vehicle, after ensuring it is safe to do so.
